info.title: Recommand Peppol API
info.description:
Welcome to the Recommand Peppol API documentation. This API provides a comprehensive set of endpoints for managing and interacting with the Recommand Peppol platform.

## Getting Started

To get started with the API:

1. Create an API key and secret in the Recommand dashboard
2. Use Basic Authentication with your API key and secret
3. Make requests to the available endpoints

## Authentication

All API requests must be authenticated using Basic Authentication, JWT bearer authentication, or OAuth2. More information on the authentication methods can be found [in the Recommand authentication guide](https://recommand.eu/en/docs/authentication-guide).

> [!TIP]
> If you are signed in to the Recommand dashboard in this browser, you can use the API client that is embedded below without creating an API key, you will be authenticated via a session cookie.

## Team and company IDs

For some endpoints, you will need to provide a team or company ID.

- You can find your team ID [here](https://app.recommand.eu/api-keys).
- You can find your company IDs [here](https://app.recommand.eu/companies).

## Support

For additional support or questions, don't hesitate to contact our support team.

httpBasic.description: Basic API key authentication. Create a new API key and secret in the Recommand dashboard.

jwt.description: JWT authentication. Create a new JWT token in the Recommand dashboard.

to.description: The email addresses to send the document to.

subject.description: The subject of the email. If not provided, the subject will be autogenerated based on the document type.

htmlBody.description: The HTML body of the email. If not provided, the body will be autogenerated based on the document type.
htmlBody.example: Dear customer, you can find your invoice attached.

Email.description: Send your document over email as well. You can choose to always send the email, or only when we cannot reach the recipient via Peppol. Each sent email is counted towards your document quota. When an email is expected to be sent, the request will succeed as long as an email has been sent, even if the Peppol sending failed (e.g. due to a non-existing Peppol address).

enabled.description: Whether to generate a PDF of the document and include it as an embedded attachment.

filename.description: Optional filename to use for the generated PDF attachment. Defaults to a filename derived from the document number (e.g. invoice-001.pdf).

PDFGeneration.description: Optionally generate a PDF of the document and include it as an embedded attachment (also included in email attachments when email sending is enabled). Not supported for message level responses or raw XML documents.

purchaseOrderReference.description: A reference to a related purchase order

salesOrderReference.description: A reference to a related sales order.

despatchReference.description: A reference to a related despatch advice document (e.g. packing slip)

paymentMeans.description: Optional payment information. For most invoices, this should be provided. For prepaid invoices, this could be omitted.

currency.description: The currency of the invoice. Defaults to EUR.

email.description: The email address of the party. If not provided, the email address will not be included in the document.

phone.description: The phone number of the party. Must contain at least 3 digits. If not provided, the phone number will not be included in the document.

locationIdentifier.description: The identifier of the delivery location. Schemes can be found [here](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/codelist/ICD/).

recipientName.description: The name of the party to which the goods and services are delivered.

name.description: The name of the payment means.

financialInstitutionBranch.description: An identifier for the payment service provider where a payment account is located. Such as a BIC or a national clearing code where required.

id.description: A line number. If not provided, it will be calculated automatically.

note.description: A textual note that gives unstructured information that is relevant to this line.

buyersId.description: The item identifier of the item as defined by the buyer.

sellersId.description: The item identifier of the item as defined by the seller. This is typically a product code or SKU.

standardId.description: The standard identifier of the item based on a registered scheme. Schemes can be found [here](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/codelist/ICD/).

documentReference.description: A reference to a related document, mostly used to refer to a related invoice.

originCountry.description: The country of origin of the item.

quantity.description: Decimal number as a string with flexible precision

unitCode.description: Recommended unit codes can be found [here](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/codelist/UNECERec20/).

netPriceAmount.description: Decimal number as a string with flexible precision

netAmount.description: The total net amount of the line: quantity * netPriceAmount. Rounded to 2 decimal places. If not provided, it will be calculated automatically.

reasonCode.description: The reason code for the discount. This must be one of the codes in the [UNCL5189 subset](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/codelist/UNCL5189/) code list. For example, `95` for regular discounts. Either reason or reasonCode must be provided.

reason.description: The reason for the discount. This is a free text field. Either reason or reasonCode must be provided.

amount.description: Decimal number as a string with 2 decimal places

reasonCode.description: The reason code for the surcharge. This must be one of the codes in the [UNCL7161 subset](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/codelist/UNCL7161/) code list. For example, `FC` for freight services. Either reason or reasonCode must be provided.

reason.description: The reason for the surcharge. This is a free text field. Either reason or reasonCode must be provided.

amount.description: Decimal number as a string with 2 decimal places

category.description: VAT category code. All codes can be found [here](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/codelist/UNCL5305/). When sending regular invoices, you should most often use the `S` category. When sending an invoice to another EU country, use the `AE` category for VAT Reverse Charge. In those cases, it is still recommended to include a note in the invoice explaining that the VAT Reverse Charge applies.

percentage.description: Decimal number as a string with 2 decimal places

reasonCode.description: The reason code for the discount. This must be one of the codes in the [UNCL5189 subset](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/codelist/UNCL5189/) code list. For example, `95` for regular discounts. Either reason or reasonCode must be provided.

reason.description: The reason for the discount. This is a free text field. Either reason or reasonCode must be provided.

amount.description: Decimal number as a string with 2 decimal places

reasonCode.description: The reason code for the surcharge. This must be one of the codes in the [UNCL7161 subset](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/codelist/UNCL7161/) code list. For example, `FC` for freight services. Either reason or reasonCode must be provided.

reason.description: The reason for the surcharge. This is a free text field. Either reason or reasonCode must be provided.

amount.description: Decimal number as a string with 2 decimal places

linesAmount.description: The tax exclusive total amount of all lines. Rounded to 2 decimal places.

discountAmount.description: The tax exclusive total amount of all discounts. If not provided, this will be calculated automatically.

surchargeAmount.description: The tax exclusive total amount of all surcharges. If not provided, this will be calculated automatically.

taxExclusiveAmount.description: The tax exclusive total amount of all lines, discounts and surcharges. Rounded to 2 decimal places.

taxInclusiveAmount.description: The tax inclusive total amount of all lines, discounts and surcharges. Rounded to 2 decimal places.

payableAmount.description: The amount to be paid. If not provided, this will be taxInclusiveAmount. Can be used in combination with paidAmount to indicate partial payment or payment rounding. Rounded to 2 decimal places.

paidAmount.description: The amount paid. If not provided, this will be taxInclusiveAmount - payableAmount. Can be used in combination with payableAmount to indicate partial payment or payment rounding. Rounded to 2 decimal places.

Totals.description: If not provided, the totals will be calculated from the document lines.

totalVatAmount.description: Decimal number as a string with 2 decimal places

taxableAmount.description: Decimal number as a string with 2 decimal places

vatAmount.description: Decimal number as a string with 2 decimal places

category.description: VAT category code. All codes can be found [here](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/codelist/UNCL5305/). When sending regular invoices, you should most often use the `S` category. When sending an invoice to another EU country, use the `AE` category for VAT Reverse Charge. In those cases, it is still recommended to include a note in the invoice explaining that the VAT Reverse Charge applies.

percentage.description: Decimal number as a string with 2 decimal places

exemptionReasonCode.description: If the invoice is exempt from VAT, this (or exemptionReason) is required. The exemption reason code identifier must belong to the CEF VATEX code list	found [here](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/2024-Q4/codelist/vatex/).

exemptionReason.description: If the invoice is exempt from VAT, this (or exemptionReasonCode) is required. The exemption reason must be a textual statement of the reason why the amount is exempt from VAT or why no VAT is charged.

mimeCode.description: MIME type of the document (e.g. application/pdf, text/csv, image/png)

issueDate.description: If not provided, the issue date will be the current date.

dueDate.description: If not provided, the due date will be 1 month from the issue date.

purchaseOrderReference.description: A reference to a related purchase order

salesOrderReference.description: A reference to a related sales order.

despatchReference.description: A reference to a related despatch advice document (e.g. packing slip)

seller.description: If not provided, the seller will be the company that is sending the invoice.

paymentMeans.description: Optional payment information. For most invoices, this should be provided. For prepaid invoices, this could be omitted.

vat.description: If not provided, the VAT totals will be calculated from the document lines.

currency.description: The currency of the invoice. Defaults to EUR.

SendInvoice.title: Invoice to send
SendInvoice.description: Invoice to send to a recipient

exemptionReasonCode.description: If the invoice is exempt from VAT, this (or exemptionReason) is required. The exemption reason code identifier must belong to the CEF VATEX code list	found [here](https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/billing/3.0/2024-Q4/codelist/vatex/).

exemptionReason.description: If the invoice is exempt from VAT, this (or exemptionReasonCode) is required. The exemption reason must be a textual statement of the reason why the amount is exempt from VAT or why no VAT is charged.

VatTotalsAutoCalculation.title: VAT totals auto calculation
VatTotalsAutoCalculation.description: Recommand will automatically calculate the VAT totals based on the document lines. For invoices that are exempt from VAT, you can provide the exemption reason or reason code here to inform the recipient of the reason why the amount is exempt from VAT.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Authentication endpoints for the Recommand Peppol API.

tags.name: Recipients
tags.description: Interaction with the Peppol directory. For now, this always returns results from the production Peppol directory, even in playground teams.

tags.name: Companies
tags.description: You can manage all companies for a team. Each business you want to send or receive Peppol documents for needs to be registered as a company.

tags.name: Company Identifiers
tags.description: You can manage all Peppol identifiers for a company. Peppol identifiers are used to identify a company in the Peppol network. They are structured as scheme:identifier, e.g. '0208:1012081766' for the Belgian business with enterprise number 1012081766.

tags.name: Company Document Types
tags.description: You can manage all Peppol document types for a company. Peppol document types are used to identify the type of document that can be received by a company.

tags.name: Company Notification Email Addresses
tags.description: You can manage all notification email addresses for a company. Notification email addresses are used to receive notifications when a document is received or sent by a company.

tags.name: Playgrounds
tags.description: Endpoints for working with playgrounds. Playgrounds are used to test the Recommand API without affecting production data or communicating over the Peppol network. A new playground can be created via the Recommand dashboard by clicking the team switcher in the top left, or via the API outlined below. Usage of the playground is free.

tags.name: Labels
tags.description: You can manage all labels for a team. Labels are used to organize and categorize your data.

tags.name: Suppliers
tags.description: You can manage all suppliers (supporting data) for a team. Suppliers are used to organize and categorize your supporting data.

tags.name: Customers
tags.description: You can manage all customers (supporting data) for a team. Customers are used to quickly fill in buyer information when sending documents.

422.description: Recipient could not be reached and no email fallback was configured or possible

post.description: Send a document to a customer

recipient.description: The Peppol address of the recipient of the document. If no identifier is provided, 0208 (Belgian Enterprise Number) is assumed.

doctypeId.description: The document type identifier. Not required, only used when documentType is "xml". For supported document types, the doctypeId can be detected automatically from your XML document, if that's not the case you can provide it manually.

processId.description: The process identifier. Not required, only used when documentType is "xml". For supported document types, the processId can be detected automatically from your XML document, if that's not the case you can provide it manually.

schema.description: Filter companies by enterprise number
Filter companies by VAT number

get.description: Get a list of all companies for a team

enterpriseNumber.description: The enterprise number of the company. Can only contain alphanumeric characters. For Belgian businesses it will be inferred from the VAT number if not provided.

skipDefaultCompanySetup.description: If true, the automatic creation of company identifiers and document types will be skipped. You will need to create them afterwards using the company identifier creation endpoint and company document type creation endpoint.
